review_title: Home to the Annual Margaret River Surf Classic. Great viewing area.
review_text:
The Point has a good parking area, good change room facilities and landscaped viewing areas and lookouts where you get a great view of the beach and, of course, any surfing going on.

The Surf Classic has been held at this site since 1978. There are three different areas Main Break, Surfside and The Box.

I would not swim here though when there is a great beach at Gnarabup a short distance away.
Beautiful beach with plenty of facilities and ample parking. Popular spot for sunset. Nearby Sea Garden restaurant worth a visit but it closes in the afternoon.

review_title: Best location to watch the wave
review_text: Went to this view point so many times during our stay in Margaret River. The view is awesome and there are many parking lots to just park and enjoy some lunch or even a drink. Its great to walk around as well and even head down to the beach.

review_title: Great view opf the Surf and Whale Watching
review_text: We were just at Surfers Point a couple of weeks ago.Luckily the sun was shinning and we had a great view of the ocean and were lucky enough to catch a glimpse of some whales in the distance.Lots of people there surfing(does anyone work midweek?) and the car park was quite full.We have been there before on a weekend and there is a coffee van there that makes a great cuppa.Probably the best part of the beach at Prevelly

The overcast conditions, rain and winds were a bit of a damper. If I was to select a favourite beach area, this would probably be it although unlikely to ever get me on a beach nowadays. Great improvements over the years with grassed areas, walking tracks, parking and allied amenities to cater for surfers and visitors. A few brave, or foolhardy, surfers on the beach, boards in hand and contemplating the swells. Didn't see any of them venture into the water while we were there.

Absolutely loved our time here, beautiful views, lots of surfers and even some seals. Love grassed areas to sit, clean toilets and lots of parking. Unfortunately a bit to cloudy for a good sunset but I bet it’s spectacular.

We visited this beach area on a windy day but apparently that's how it always is. It's very well organised with very good car parking, toilets and boardwalk and viewing areas for those who want to enjoy watching the surfers, sailboarders and the like. Great to be able to avoid sand!

When we were there we saw sailboarders and kite surfers. All very experienced judging by their skill levels. The sea was certainly making them work.

Worth a visit.
Todays trip was our second time in 2 years at this location. Always fresh breeze and stunning beaches. Finally we got a time to catch up on some suntan. Chillax at its best

review_title: Absolute must see when at Margaret river region
review_text: We are not surfers but we always enjoy visiting prevelley surfers point every time we are in the area . About 10 minutes drive from Margaret river township , it has stunning views of the ocean . Its very well set up for families with barbecues, benches and stairs all the way to the beach . Dog friendly beach. Toilets and showers too. Great place to catch the sunset and go for long walks .

review_title: Stunning beach view with strong waves
review_text: Stunning beach view with strong waves. I was so amazed to see such a beautiful beach that is used for surfing competitions in Australia. I came in march 2020, thus the weather is a bit weird with little rains, cold strong wind, and most of time sunshine. But the view is simply breathtaking, nothing in my experience comes close to this.

Home to Margaret River Pro competition and the international surfing circuit this beach has you covered. From parking to walking trails and from pavilions with picnic tables to grassy lawns, there’s room to enjoy a sunset, launch your board, or be a bystander. Popular among locals and visiting tourists this beach is on the top ten for Margaret River.

Beware the Surfers Pro is a media circus.

review_title: Great place to chill and relax.
review_text: Nice cooling breeze on the beach. A great place to watch the surfers and wind surfers. Clean toilets at the car park, plus grassed areas to sit on if you don’t want to go on the beach.

review_title: A must do in Margaret River area
review_text: Fantastic view.  Lovely lawn. Great for the active or less active. Beautiful walk paths to River Mouth.

Mate, if u want to watch the surfers in the morning, or kite surfers, and sailboarding in the arvo, this is it in Margaret River. Without to much ado, this is the el primo spot for surfing and surf watching. Enjoy
Nice place to enjoy the beautiful sunset and watch the experienced surfers in action. Probably wouldn’t bother with the heavily battered fish n chips from the on site van though.

Western Australian beaches are famed for the sunset over the ocean, however an early morning trip to watch the sunrise here showed a serene and alternative view of this picturesque location. A must see if in the region and worth exploring the rocks next to the point

Amazing views from the place overlooking the ocean.
Ample parking and also has viewing deck and steps even to go down to the beach.
Also an amazing cafe right on the beach which is another highlight
Visited on Tuesday 26th November. Wow what a great beach for the surfers and all those who what a great view of the coastline here. Plenty of parking spots and so close to Margaret River as well.

review_title: At The Mouth Of Margaret River
review_text: Located adjacent to the mouth of the Margaret River this is a pretty and interesting rocky beach and surfing point  with great scenery on a rugged coastline. The park and amenities are well set up and this is a nice part of the coast which is generally very beautiful.

Visiting vineyards and stopped to check out town and catch quick lunch. The place is easy to find and the views are amazing. We did need to spend a lot of time.  Surfing not active that day.  One of the many outstanding vistas around the area.

The community / council has done a really good job developing a wide cement walkway along the foreshore dotted with steel sculptures and information panels adding interest. A true surfer has to at least stop and have a look; nice spot for a walk; plenty of joggers and walkers taking advantage of the pathway.

Another beautiful beach where the surfers all go. Beautiful sand and the sea very clear with little pools where you can go for a swim .Walked all along the beach to the mouth of the river.Then walked back and sat whatching the sea and the surfers lovely way to pass some time you will feel very chilled following a visit here

I just love this beach for the interesting bay, white sand, exciting ocean and surfing and rugged landscape. A great place to chill on the beach or watch the ocean from the boardwalk and picnic on the grass it even has a bbq. Amazing sunsets too. We stayed until everyone was gone, so relaxing.

review_title: Beautiful beaches scenery and wild flowers
review_text:
Went to Surfers Point which is very scenic and obviously a surfers hot spot. The pod of Dolphins we saw too abviously love surfing there too!
You can spend hours watching the breakers etc and its every changing.
Going in October is Western Australias Spring so the flowers were out and looked amazing

Good spot to catch the sunset, as long as there was no cloud cover.
It’s very windy and chilly too. So make sure you rug up. Parking is very convenient
I am certain it would make an excellent picnic spot, again as long as you rug up and keep warm
One could watch waves coming in for hours
This is a great spot to see some awesome waves and maybe catch a hardy surfer or two trying their luck.

review_title: Great vantage spot to watch the surf
review_text:
We went there mid afternoon and a reasonable wave was breaking. Some skilled surfers were out putting on a show.
The car park and viewing area is well maintained and there were were some reasonably detailed displays providing some information on the history and surfing locations. I’d like to see these better maintained as they getting s little rust stained but overall I got a good impression of an iconic Australian surfing location.

We always drive out here to watch the surfers. This particular afternoon the surf was not great but the view from the car park was wonderful, with the beautiful blue sky reflected in the water. The car park is well maintained and nicely landscaped, with board walks protecting the dunes.
Gorgeous beach. Full of families, surfers & couples. Would definitely recommend a visit to the area. Amazing scenery
Very beautiful scenery at Surfers Point.  Stunning coastline with huge waves.  Stood there for a long while to just starring at the sea and the skyline.  I enjoyed every minutes there.

Home to Margaret River Pro competition and the international surfing circuit this beach has you covered. From parking to walking trails and from pavilions with picnic tables to grassy lawns, there’s room to enjoy a sunset, launch your board, or be a bystander. Popular among locals and visiting tourists this beach is on the top ten for Margaret River.
